column4: Do you know what it means when I get this during mounting network shares process: 8931: session setup failed: ERRDOS - ERRnoaccess (Access denied.)
SMB connection failed
that would be an access denied message.
I know, but why? I am using "sudo" command to mount resources.
you dont have perms on the remote machine.

ok but this resources what I want to get are on my ubuntu machine. It is very weird for me that I can explore them thanks to WIN XP on other side of network, but I can't do this from my system using default file manager.
when I want to explore this file then I get: the folder contents could not be displayed.
This is ubuntu support.. your error is a Windows side error.
but I would bet a beer or two its a windowspermission issue
You maybe don't understand. This has nothing with Windows. I want to explore my own directories on my ubuntu machine throught ubuntu graphic file manager.
and whats the problem?
what folder are you trying to view
No I want to view my home folder throught this graphic windows manager - smb://opexoc/homes. And I get what I said.
but when I want to explore it thanks to windows xp then I have to put password and I can do explore it.
so, I offer my previous assertion once again -- you have a samba permissions issue.
because I am testing samba. What I can do and what I can't.
its either software,hardware, or user error.
it sounds like youve tested software and hardware
I just wonder why I can't explore my own resources.
so, I offer my previous assertion once again -- you have a samba permissions issue. <<<<
yes. probably. But do you know what should I do to repair that ( any suggestions? )?
